001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.math.BigDecimal;
004import java.sql.SQLException;
005import java.time.LocalDateTime;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.stream.Collectors;
008
009import org.duckdb.DuckDBAppender;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
012
013/**
014 * Utility class for DuckDB database operations and type mapping.
015 * <p>
016 * This class provides functionality for appending Java objects to DuckDB tables
017 * and generating SQL CREATE TABLE statements based on Java class metadata. The
018 * class handles type mapping between Java types and DuckDB SQL types,
019 * supporting primitive types, wrapper classes, and common Java types.
020 *
021 * @author Rob Challen
022 * @see org.duckdb.DuckDBAppender
023 * @see com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty
024 */
025
026public class DuckDBUtil {
027
028        /**
029         * Appends a Java object to a DuckDB table using type-specific appender
030         * methods.
031         * <p>
032         * This method performs type-based dispatch to invoke the appropriate
033         * DuckDBAppender method for the given object type. Supported types include
034         * primitive types, their wrapper classes, BigDecimal, LocalDateTime, and
035         * String. If the object type is not supported, an IllegalArgumentException
036         * is thrown.
037         *
038         * @param appender the DuckDBAppender instance to append data to
039         * @param value    the object to append, must be of a supported type
040         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the object type is not supported
041         * @throws RuntimeException         if a SQLException occurs during appending
042         */
043        public static void append(DuckDBAppender appender, Object value) {
044                try {
045                        if (value instanceof Boolean) {
046                                appender.append(((Boolean) value).booleanValue());
047                        } else if (value instanceof Byte) {
048                                appender.append(((Byte) value).byteValue());
049                        } else if (value instanceof Short) {
050                                appender.append(((Short) value).shortValue());
051                        } else if (value instanceof Integer) {
052                                appender.append(((Integer) value).intValue());
053                        } else if (value instanceof Long) {
054                                appender.append(((Long) value).longValue());
055                        } else if (value instanceof Float) {
056                                appender.append(((Float) value).floatValue());
057                        } else if (value instanceof Double) {
058                                appender.append(((Double) value).doubleValue());
059                        } else if (value instanceof String) {
060                                appender.append((String) value);
061                        } else if (value instanceof BigDecimal) {
062                                appender.appendBigDecimal((BigDecimal) value);
063                        } else if (value instanceof LocalDateTime) {
064                                appender.appendLocalDateTime((LocalDateTime) value);
065                        } else
066                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
067                                                "Unsupported type for DuckDB Appender"
068                                );
069                } catch (SQLException e) {
070                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
071                }
072        }
073
074        /**
075         * Generates a CREATE TABLE SQL statement for a given Java class.
076         * <p>
077         * This method constructs SQL DDL statements dynamically by analysing methods
078         * annotated with {@link JsonProperty} in the specified class. The generated
079         * SQL creates a table with columns corresponding to each annotated property.
080         *
081         * @param <X>       the class type parameter
082         * @param type      the Java class to generate SQL for
083         * @param tableName the name of the table to create
084         * @return a complete CREATE TABLE SQL statement
085         */
086        public static <X> String createSql(Class<X> type, String tableName) {
087                return "CREATE TABLE " + tableName + " ("
088                                + Arrays.stream(type.getMethods())
089                                                .filter(c -> c.isAnnotationPresent(JsonProperty.class))
090                                                .map(
091                                                                m -> m.getAnnotation(JsonProperty.class).value() + " "
092                                                                                + mapToDuckDBType(m.getReturnType())
093                                                ).collect(Collectors.joining(","))
094                                + ")";
095        }
096
097        /**
098         * Maps Java class types to corresponding DuckDB SQL types.
099         * <p>
100         * This function implements the type mapping covering both primitive types
101         * and their corresponding wrapper classes, plus additional Java types
102         * commonly used in database applications.
103         * <p>
104         * The mapping logic handles primitive types first, then falls back to
105         * wrapper classes and common Java types. Unsupported types result in an
106         * IllegalArgumentException being thrown.
107         *
108         * @param clazz the Java class to map to a DuckDB type
109         * @return the corresponding DuckDB SQL type as a string
110         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if clazz is null or unsupported
111         */
112        public static String mapToDuckDBType(Class<?> clazz) {
113                if (clazz == null)
114                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Class cannot be null");
115
116                if (clazz.isPrimitive()) {
117                        if (clazz == boolean.class) return "BOOLEAN";
118                        if (clazz == byte.class) return "TINYINT";
119                        if (clazz == short.class) return "SMALLINT";
120                        if (clazz == int.class) return "INTEGER";
121                        if (clazz == long.class) return "BIGINT";
122                        if (clazz == float.class) return "FLOAT";
123                        if (clazz == double.class) return "DOUBLE";
124                } else {
125                        if (clazz == Boolean.class) return "BOOLEAN";
126                        if (clazz == Byte.class) return "TINYINT";
127                        if (clazz == Short.class) return "SMALLINT";
128                        if (clazz == Integer.class) return "INTEGER";
129                        if (clazz == Long.class) return "BIGINT";
130                        if (clazz == Float.class) return "FLOAT";
131                        if (clazz == Double.class) return "DOUBLE";
132                        if (clazz == BigDecimal.class) return "DECIMAL";
133                        if (clazz == LocalDateTime.class) return "TIMESTAMP";
134                        if (clazz == String.class) return "VARCHAR";
135                }
136
137                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
138                                "Unsupported type for DuckDB Appender: " + clazz.getName()
139                );
140        }
141}
